body:
Comment 2: 
The "Type declarations" section also says (further down):

"A type declaration may be used to define a different boolean, numeric, or string
type..."

which implies that these newly declared types are also boolean, numeric, or strings,
respectively. Operators are defined on those "qualities", for instance, in the
"Arithmetic operators" section:

"Arithmetic operators apply to numeric values..."

Thus, I think technically we already say everything. That said,  glyn.normington's
suggestion is a good one and I have added a respective sentence to the "Types" intro.
See: https://golang.org/cl/100130044 .
_Status changed to **Started**._
